page.title: 18Moat
page.content: A{moated manor house}once stood at the northern end of Weston, but all traces of the building have gone. Instead it is an undulating grazing field, known as "Hall Yard", though the depression in the land shows clearly where the moat was. It is approx. 10 feet wide and 8 feet deep, and the island is approx. 40 paces by 30 paces. Between the moat and the nearby stream there is a small rectangular depression which may have been a{fishpond,}or part of the{leat} workings, controlling the water supply to the moat. The site is officially listed among the ancient monuments of agricultural and historical interest. Nothing is known of the manor house that stood there, but it is thought that it was built before the Black Death and fell into decay afterwards.
